translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The third section
Discussion of the eighth faculty
Is there no faith faculty in the eighth person?
“Yes.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa na atthi saddhā ati
translated: “Is there no faith in the eighth person?”
“You may not say so.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa natthi vīriya indriyam pe  na atthi sat indriyam pe
translated: “Is there no energy faculty …🔽no mindfulness faculty …
no concentration faculty …
no understanding faculty in the eighth person?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa na atthi paññā ati
translated: “Is there no understanding in the eighth person?”
“You may not say so.”
“Is there faith in the eighth person?”
“Yes.”
“Is there a faith faculty in the eighth person?”
“You may not say so.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi vīriyam pe  atthi sati
translated: “Is there energy in the eighth person …🔽Is there mindfulness …
Is there concentration …
Is there understanding in the eighth person?”
“Yes.”
“Is there an understanding faculty in the eighth person?”
“You may not say so.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi mano, atthi manindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi manaḥ atthi manindriyanti
translated: “Does the eighth person have mind, does he have the mind faculty?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, atthi saddhindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā atthi saddhi indriyan ti
translated: “Does the eighth person have faith, does he have the faith faculty?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi mano, atthi manindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi manaḥ atthi manindriyanti
translated: “Does the eighth person have mind, does he have the mind faculty?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā, atthi paññindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā atthi paññindriyanti
translated: “Does the eighth person have understanding, does he have the understanding faculty?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi somanassaṁ, atthi somanassindriyaṁ, atthi jīvitaṁ, atthi jīvitindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi somanassa atthi somanassa indriya atthi jīvita atthi jīvita indriya nti
translated: “Does the eighth person have joy, does he have the joy faculty, does he have life, does he have the life faculty?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, atthi saddhindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā atthi saddhi indriyan ti
translated: “Does the eighth person have faith, does he have the faith faculty?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi jīvitaṁ, atthi jīvitindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi jīvita atthi jīvitindriyanti
translated: “Does the eighth person have life, does he have the life faculty?”
“Yes.”
“Does the eighth person have …
understanding, does he have the understanding faculty?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, natthi saddhindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā natthi saddhi indriyan ti
translated: “Does the eighth person have faith, but not the faith faculty?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi mano, natthi manindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi manaḥ na atthi manindriyanti
translated: “Does the eighth person have mind, but not the mind faculty?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, natthi saddhindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā natthi saddhi indriyan ti
translated: “Does the eighth person have faith, but not the faith faculty?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi somanassaṁ, natthi somanassindriyanti …pe… atthi jīvitaṁ, natthi jīvitindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi somanassa natthi somanassa indriya nti pe atthi jīvita natthi jīvita indriya nti
translated: “Does the eighth person have joy, but not the joy faculty … does he have life, but not the life faculty?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā, natthi paññindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā natthi paññindriyanti
translated: “Does the eighth person have understanding, but not the understanding faculty?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi mano, natthi manindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi manaḥ na atthi manindriyanti
translated: “Does the eighth person have mind, but not the mind faculty?
Does he have joy, but not the joy faculty?
Does he have life, but not the life faculty?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is it that the eighth person does not have the faith faculty?”
“Yes.”
“Is the eighth person faithless?”
“No.”🔽“Is the eighth person faithless?”
“Does the eighth person not have the faculty of energy?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamako puggalo kusītaḥ hīna vīriyo ti
translated: “Is the eighth person lazy and low in energy?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the past, the future, and the present?” …
“Does the eighth person not have the faculty of mindfulness?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamakaḥ puggalo muṭṭhaḥ sati a sampajānoti
translated: “Is the eighth person muddle-minded and not fully aware?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Does the eighth person not have the faculty of concentration?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamakaḥ puggalo asamāhitaḥ vibbhanta citto ti
translated: “Is the eighth person not concentrated, but has a scattered mind?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Does the eighth person not have the faculty of wisdom?”
“Yes.”
“Is the eighth person unwise and stupid?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, sā ca saddhā niyyānikāti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā sā ca saddhā niyyānikā ti
translated: “Does the eighth person have faith, and is that faith leading to release?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, sā ca saddhā niyyānikā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā sā ca saddhā niyyānikā no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Well, if the eighth person has faith, and that faith is leading to release, then it must be said that
the eighth person has the faculty of faith.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi vīriyaṁ, tañca vīriyaṁ niyyānikaṁ;🔽atthi sati, sā ca sati niyyānikā;
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi tat ca vīriyam  atthi sati sā ca sati niyyānikā
translated: Does the eighth person have energy, and is that energy leading to …🔽Does he have mindfulness, and is that mindfulness leading to …

original: atthi samādhi, so ca samādhi niyyāniko;
analyzed: atthi samādhi so ca samādhi niyyāniko
translated: Does he have concentration, and is that concentration leading to …

original: atthi paññā, sā ca paññā niyyānikāti?
analyzed: atthi paññā sā ca paññā niyyānikā ati
translated: Does he have wisdom, and is that wisdom leading to …?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā, sā ca paññā niyyānikā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā sā ca paññā niyyānikā no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Well then, you misrepresent the Accomplished One; it is not right to misrepresent the Accomplished One, sirs, for the Accomplished One would not say:
‘The eighth person does not have the faculty of wisdom.’

original: Sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, atthi saddhindriyanti?
analyzed: sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi saddhā atthi saddhi indriyan ti
translated: “Is there faith in a person practicing for realization of the fruit of once-returning? Is there the faculty of faith?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, atthi saddhindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā atthi saddhi indriyan ti
translated: “Is there faith in the eighth person? Is there the faculty of faith?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi paññā, atthi paññindriyanti?
analyzed: sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi paññā atthi paññindriyan ti
translated: “Is there wisdom in a person practicing for realization of the fruit of once-returning? Is there the faculty of wisdom?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā, atthi paññindriyanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā atthi paññindriyanti
translated: “Is there wisdom in the eighth person? Is there the faculty of wisdom?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa …🔽arahattasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, atthi saddhindriyaṁ …pe…
analyzed: anāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa  arahatta sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi saddhā atthi saddhi indriyam pe
translated: “Is there faith in a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of non-return? …🔽Is there wisdom in a person who is practicing for the realization of arahantship? …
“Is there wisdom in a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of arahantship? …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā, atthi paññindriyanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā atthi paññindriyanti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is there wisdom in a person who is an arahant? …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, natthi saddhindriyanti?🔽Āmantā.
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā natthi saddhi indriyan ti  āmantā
translated: “Is there faith in a person who is an arahant? …

original: Sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, natthi saddhindriyanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…
analyzed: sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi saddhā natthi saddhi indriyan ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is there faith in a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry? …

original: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā, natthi paññindriyanti?🔽Āmantā.
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi paññā natthi paññindriyanti  āmantā
translated: “Is there wisdom in a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry? …🔽“Is there faith in a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of once-returning? …

original: Sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi paññā, natthi paññindriyanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi paññā natthi paññindriyan ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is there wisdom in a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of once-returning? …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā, natthi saddhindriyanti …pe…
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi saddhā natthi saddhi indriya nti pe
translated: “Is there faith in a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of non-return? …
Is there understanding, but not the faculty of understanding?
You may reply.
In a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of non-return …

original: arahattasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi paññā, natthi paññindriyanti?
analyzed: arahatta sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa atthi paññā natthi paññindriyan ti
translated: In a person who is practicing for the realization of perfection, is there understanding, but not the faculty of understanding?
You may not say that.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa natthi pañca indriyāni iti
translated: Does the eighth person not have the five faculties?
You may reply.
But hasn’t it been said by the Buddha:
“Monks, there are these five faculties.
What five?
The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
These are the five faculties.

original: Imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṁ indriyānaṁ samattā paripūrattā arahā hoti.🔽Tato mudutarehi arahattasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno hoti, tato mudutarehi anāgāmī hoti,
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave pañcannam indriyānam samattā paripūrattā arahā hoti  tatas mudutarehi arahatta sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ hoti tatas mudutarehi anāgāmī hoti
translated: When these five faculties are fulfilled and complete, one is perfected.🔽One who has weaker faculties is practicing for the realization of perfection. One who has still weaker faculties is a non-returner.

original: tato mudutarehi anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno hoti, tato mudutarehi sakadāgāmī
analyzed: tatas mudutarehi anāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ hoti tatas mudutarehi sakadāgāmī
translated: One who has still weaker faculties is practicing for the realization of the fruit of non-return. One who has still weaker faculties is a once-returner.

original: hoti, tato mudutarehi sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno hoti, tato mudutarehi
analyzed: hoti tatas mudutarehi sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ hoti tatas mudutarehi
translated: He is more advanced than one who is practising for the fruit of once-returning.

original: sotāpanno hoti, tato mudutarehi sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno hoti.
analyzed: sotāpannaḥ hoti tatas mudutarehi sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ hoti
translated: He is more advanced than one who is a stream-enterer. He is more advanced than one who is practising for the fruit of stream-entry.

original: Yassa kho, bhikkhave, imāni pañcindriyāni sabbena sabbaṁ sabbathā sabbaṁ natthi, tamahaṁ ‘bāhiro puthujjanapakkhe ṭhito’ti vadāmī”ti.
analyzed: yassa kho bhikkhave imāni pañca indriyāni sabbena sabbam sabbathā sabbam na atthi tam aham bāhiraḥ puthujjana pakkhe ṭhitaḥ iti vadāmi iti
translated: “Bhikkhus, I say that a person in whom these five faculties are completely and totally absent is outside the Dispensation.”
“Is there such a sutta?”
“Yes, there is.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamakaḥ puggalo bāhiraḥ puthujjana pakkhe ṭhito ti
translated: “Is the eighth person outside the Dispensation, a worldling standing on the side of ordinary people?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽tena hi aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi pañcindriyānīti.
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  tena hi aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa atthi pañca indriyāni iti
translated: “No, that is not so.”🔽“Well then, the eighth person possesses the five faculties.”
The Discussion of the Eighth Person is finished.
